title: Gradle `quarkusIntTest` produces `container.log` in `target` directory

labels.name: triage/out-of-date
labels.description: This issue/PR is no longer valid or relevant

body:
### Describe the bug

Gradle `quarkusIntTest` generates the `container.log` in `<project>/target` not `<project>/build`.

Pedantically, for Gradle this should be in `build/test-results/quarkusIntTest` as this is where all results from this test run are stored.

### Expected behavior

`container.log` is generated in `build/test-results/quarkusIntTest` or at least in `build`.

### Actual behavior

`container.log` is generated in `target`.

### How to Reproduce?

Run a `quarkusIntTest` task in a Gradle build.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

macOS 13.2.1

### Output of `java -version`

java version "17.0.2" 2022-01-18 LTS
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 17.0.2+8-LTS-86)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 17.0.2+8-LTS-86, mixed mode, sharing)


### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.16.4

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Gradle 7.5.1

### Additional information

_No response_
